summary_points: 1. Senate Bill 254, creating an $18 billion wildfire cost fund split between customers and utilities, was approved on September 13, 2025.
2.  SCE's subrogation settlement for the Eaton Fire reached $500 million by July 31, 2025, representing a 52% payout to insurance claimants.
3. Edison International and SCE must assess new wildfire risk-sharing models by April 1, 2026, due to potential Wildfire Insurance Fund exhaustion and regulatory uncertainty.

1. On September 12, 2025, Intel completed the sale of a 51% stake in its Altera business to an affiliate of Silver Lake for approximately $3.3 billion, retaining a 49% interest in a newly formed limited partnership.
2. Intel revised its full-year 2025 non-GAAP operating expense target to $16.8 billion (from $17 billion) due to the deconsolidation of Altera, while maintaining its 2026 target of $16 billion.

3. Intel's Q3 2025 consolidated financial statements will include Altera's results from June 29, 2025, through September 11, 2025, with Intel using the equity method of accounting for its minority investment in Altera thereafter.
